title.en: The World, Foreseen by a Master of the Manga World

altTitles.ja: コミック界の巨匠“世界”をよむ

altTitles.ja-ro: Comic Kai no Kyosho  "Sekai" wo Yomu

altTitles.en: The World, Forseen by a Master of the Comics World

description.en:
*All Digital Editions of the Manga Have Been Delisted as of 2019*

(from ebookjapan):
A collection of short stories about the lives of world leaders active in the second half of the 20th century, including Yeltsin, Bush, Ferrari and Soichiro Honda! In addition to the title work, "Cyborg 009: Emergency Simulation 1992", the last of "009" by Shotaro Ishinomori, and a manga of interviews with Japanese businessmen are included, as well as other current affairs and documentary manga done in the late 1980s and early 1990s. With a sharp clairvoyant eye, the book provides an insight into the Japanese economy and world affairs during this turbulent period!

biography.en:
石森章太郎
Ishinomori Shotaro
==
Real name Onodera Shotaro. He was known as Ishimori Shotaro before 1986 when he changed his name to Ishinomori Shotaro.

While he was in high school, he made his debut with Nikyu Tenshi in Manga Shônen (1954). Like most of the Japanese artists, Ishimori was influenced by Tezuka Osamu. In 1956, he formed a coterie group with Akatsuka Fujio, Nagashima Shinji and Suzuki Mitsuaki. He moved to Tokyo after graduation, where he continued to work as a mangaka, starting with the war story Kaiketsu Harimao in 1959. Subsequently, he produced hit mangas such as the science fiction series Cyborg 009 (1964) and the historical series Sabu to Ichi Torimono Hikae (Big Comic, 1968-72). In the 1970s, Ishimori created metamorphosis manga such as Kamen Rider and in the 1980s, he became a pioneer of a new manga category. In 1989, he commenced working on a large series about the history of Japan, Manga Nihon no Rekishi, which remained unfinished due to the artist's death on January 28th, 1998 at the age of 60.

Ishinomori was nicknamed the 'King of Manga' and is considered one of the pioneers of modern manga. He was also one of the most productive creators, producing over 120,000 pages of artwork in thirty years. It's rumored that he drew over 500 pages in one month!

石森章太郎
Ishinomori Shotaro
==

While he was in high school, he made his debut with Nikyu Tenshi in Manga Shônen (1954). Like most of the Japanese artists, Ishimori was influenced by Tezuka Osamu. In 1956, he formed a coterie group with Akatsuka Fujio, Nagashima Shinji and Suzuki Mitsuaki. He moved to Tokyo after graduation, where he continued to work as a mangaka, starting with the war story Kaiketsu Harimao in 1959. Subsequently, he produced hit mangas such as the science fiction series Cyborg 009 (1964) and the historical series Sabu to Ichi Torimono Hikae (Big Comic, 1968-72). In the 1970s, Ishimori created metamorphosis manga such as Kamen Rider and in the 1980s, he became a pioneer of a new manga category.
